sg.edu.cs2103aug2015_w13_2j

Interface LogicInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Logic

    public interface LogicInterface
    Interface for a FunDUE logic component. Provides methods to modify the master list of Task objects as well as methods to interact with the UIInterface and StorageInterface components via pass-through methods.
    Author:
    Zhu Chunqi

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTask(Task task)
      Adds the provided Task object to the master list of Task objects.
      void clearRedoHistory()
      Clears the redo stack.
      void clearUndoHistory()
      Clears the undo history stack until the root history is reached.
      void display()
      Sends the master list of Task objects to the UIInterface component to be displayed.
      void executeCommand(java.lang.String command)
      Executes the command string entered by the user.
      void feedback(FeedbackMessage feedback)
      Pass-through method to UIInterface.feedback(FeedbackMessage) which displays the provided FeedbackMessage object to the user.
      java.util.ArrayList<Task> getAllTasks()
      Retrieves the master list of (Task objects existing locally in the Logic component.

      Retrieves the HashMap of reserved keyword strings to their respective CommandHandler objects.

      Pass-through method to StorageInterface.getDataFile() which retrieves the File object representing the current FunDUE data file.

      Retrieves the Set of reserved keyword strings registered by CommandHandler objects during FunDUE initialization.

      Retrieves the Task object associated with the provided index from the master list of Task objects.

      Injects the dependency on StorageInterface and UIInterface components into this LogicInterface component.

      Pass-through method to UIInterface.popFilter() which pops the top most Filter object from the filter chain stack and returns it.

      Pass-through method to UIInterface.pushFilter(Filter) which pushes the provided Filter object onto the filter chain stack.

      Reads the master list of Task objects from the FunDUE data file using the StorageInterface component.

    • Method Detail

      • injectDependencies

        void injectDependencies(StorageInterface storage,
                        UIInterface textUI)
        Injects the dependency on StorageInterface and UIInterface components into this LogicInterface component.
        Parameters:
        storage - StorageInterface component to be used. A handle to this component will be retained for subsequent I/O method calls.
        textUI - UIInterface component to be used. A handle to this component will be retained for when a CommandHandler requires data to be displayed or FeedbackMessage to be shown.

      • getReservedKeywords

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getReservedKeywords()
        Retrieves the Set of reserved keyword strings registered by CommandHandler objects during FunDUE initialization.
        Returns:
        Set of reserved keyword strings.
        See Also:
        registerCommandHandler(CommandHandler)

      • getCommandHandlers

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,CommandHandler> getCommandHandlers()
        Retrieves the HashMap of reserved keyword strings to their respective CommandHandler objects.
        Returns:
        HashMap mapping reserved keyword strings to their respective CommandHandler objects.

      • registerCommandHandler

        void registerCommandHandler(CommandHandler handler)
        Registers the provided CommandHandler object with this LogicInterface component. Adds all reserved keyword strings retrieved via CommandHandler.getReservedKeywords() to the complete set of reserved keywords and maps them to this CommandHandler object.
        Parameters:
        handler - CommandHandler object to be registered.

      • executeCommand

        void executeCommand(java.lang.String command)
        Executes the command string entered by the user.
        Parameters:
        command - Command string to execute.

      • display

        void display()
        Sends the master list of Task objects to the UIInterface component to be displayed.

      • feedback

        void feedback(FeedbackMessage feedback)
        Pass-through method to UIInterface.feedback(FeedbackMessage) which displays the provided FeedbackMessage object to the user.
        Parameters:
        feedback - FeedbackMessage object to be displayed.

      • showChangeDataFilePathDialog

        boolean showChangeDataFilePathDialog()
        Pass-through method to UIInterface.showChangeDataFilePathDialog() which shows a file picker dialog to let the user choose a new FunDUE data file.
        Returns:
        True if a file was chosen, false otherwise.

      • showHelpPage

        boolean showHelpPage()
        Pass-through method to UIInterface.showHelpPage() which shows the FunDUE Help Page window.
        Returns:
        True if the FunDUE Help Page was shown, false if the window was already showing.

      • addTask

        void addTask(Task task)
        Adds the provided Task object to the master list of Task objects.
        Parameters:
        task - Task object to be added.

      • getAllTasks

        java.util.ArrayList<Task> getAllTasks()
        Retrieves the master list of (Task objects existing locally in the Logic component.
        Returns:
        Master list of Task objects

      • getTask

        Task getTask(int index)
      throws TaskNotFoundException
        Retrieves the Task object associated with the provided index from the master list of Task objects. The provided index is specific to the way the UIInterface component chooses to display and index the master list of Task objects. Therefore, UIInterface.getTask(int) is first called to retrieve the Task object from the UIInterface component, ArrayList.indexOf(Object) is called to retrieve the corresponding index in the master list of Task objects, and finally that index is used to retrieve the associated Task object from the master list of Task objects.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the Task object to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        Task object associated with the provided index.
        Throws:
        TaskNotFoundException - Thrown when the provided index is out of bounds.

      • removeTask

        Task removeTask(Task task)
         throws TaskNotFoundException
        Removes the Task object from the master list of Task objects. ArrayList.remove(Object) is called to remove the Task object from the master list of Task objects.
        Parameters:
        task - Task object to be removed.
        Returns:
        Task object specified. An exception will be thrown if any provided index is out of bounds.
        Throws:
        TaskNotFoundException - Thrown when the provided index is out of bounds.

      • removeTask

        Task removeTask(int index)
         throws TaskNotFoundException
        Removes the Task object associated with the provided index from the master list of Task objects. The provided index is specific to the way the UIInterface component chooses to display and index the master list of Task objects. Therefore, UIInterface.getTask(int) is first called to retrieve the Task object associated with the provided index, then ArrayList.remove(Object) is called to remove the Task object from the master list of Task objects.
        Parameters:
        index - Integer index of the Task object to be removed.
        Returns:
        Task object associated with the provided index. An exception will be thrown if the provided index is out of bounds.
        Throws:
        TaskNotFoundException - Thrown when the provided index is out of bounds.

      • readTasks

        void readTasks()
        Reads the master list of Task objects from the FunDUE data file using the StorageInterface component. The current master list of Task objects will be cleared first.

      • writeTasks

        void writeTasks()
        Writes the master list of Task objects to the FunDUE data file using the StorageInterface component.

      • getDataFile

        java.io.File getDataFile()
        Pass-through method to StorageInterface.getDataFile() which retrieves the File object representing the current FunDUE data file.
        Returns:
        File object representing the current FunDUE data file.

      • setDataFile

        void setDataFile(java.io.File dataFile)
        Pass-through method to StorageInterface.setDataFile(File) which sets the provided File object as the new FunDUE data file.
        Parameters:
        dataFile - File object to be used as the FunDUE data file.

      • pushFilter

        void pushFilter(Filter filter)
        Pass-through method to UIInterface.pushFilter(Filter) which pushes the provided Filter object onto the filter chain stack.
        Parameters:
        filter - Filter object to be pushed onto the filter chain stack.

      • popFilter

        Filter popFilter()
        Pass-through method to UIInterface.popFilter() which pops the top most Filter object from the filter chain stack and returns it.
        Returns:
        Filter object that was popped from the filter chain stack or null if only the root Filter is left.

      • storeCommandInHistory

        void storeCommandInHistory()
        Stores a deep copy of the master list of Task objects into the undo stack.

      • storeCommandInRedoHistory

        void storeCommandInRedoHistory(java.util.ArrayList<Task> taskListToRedo)
        Stores a deep copy of a Task list into the redo stack.
        Parameters:
        taskListToRedo - List of Task objects to be stored in redo history.

      • clearUndoHistory

        void clearUndoHistory()
        Clears the undo history stack until the root history is reached.

      • clearRedoHistory

        void clearRedoHistory()
        Clears the redo stack.

      • restoreCommandFromHistory

        java.util.ArrayList<Task> restoreCommandFromHistory()
        Retrieves the most recent user command, if any. The undo stack initializes with the user's saved master Task list on its root stack and will only be restored until that particular entry.
        Returns:
        List of Task objects that will be displayed after restoring from the undo stack.

      • restoreCommandFromRedoHistory

        java.util.ArrayList<Task> restoreCommandFromRedoHistory()
        Obtains the last command the user undid, if any. The redo stack initializes with no Task list and will only be restored until that particular empty entry.
        Returns:
        List of Task objects that will be displayed to the user after restoring from the redo stack.
